channel.title: Help with server actually being online
channel.description:
Hi, I've made a server and everything, I portforwarded, and made a no-ip (ex. blahblah.no-ip.biz) and I have a server source file and everything. It's all set to compile... Well, let's just say everything is all set and ready to go. I am just confused on how to get it on the internet so people can connect to my server?
All I can do is "localhost" but when I go to another computer and type in the no-ip and server source port it says the server is down.
HELP PLEASE!
Thank-you!

item.title: Help with server actually being online
item.dc:creator: @Super_Novex Super Novex
item.description:
@Super_Novex wrote:

Again, when I compile the server is this what it’s supposed to look like?

and could someone please give me a step to step walkthrough to making the server open to public?

I tried compiling and running the server and keeping it running, going to my router, portforwarding it by typing in the service name, port numbers 5555 and 5555 because that’s what the pimpscape server run says for the port. then typing in for the last IP I type in 192.168.0.1 and press apply or whatever.

Well, here are some screen shots instead. Please help me, I can’t get on my server when it’s running from another computer. Am I supposed to compile the server source to No-ip or something? I know something is being left out. Please help!

[br][size=1]Posted on: August 22, 2007, 10:40:48 AM[/size][hr]Help please!

Read full topic
item.source: Help with server actually being online

item.title: Help with server actually being online
item.dc:creator: @s0ul_reap3r s0ul reap3r
item.description:
@s0ul_reap3r wrote:

um im not sure how to say this but your cometley wrong,

  1. yes you do have to port forward on your modem
    2.personally i never had to take down my firewall after i portforwarded also, jungledude is compelty correct on his point
  2. ok you stated that
xxxxxx 13:

…u dont need to speak to me like that. and with a modem only YOU CANT PORT FORWARD only with a router can you. So still. you have to take down firewall. and no one will hack you still. because all the wanna be hackers dont realize that though a firewall my be down there are still hacker protectants

which in retrospectove terms says real hackers could get in firewalls do protect against hackers but when you put it down hackers,virus,trojans,keyloggers, ect. would all get in through someone enter a code on your server

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @jungledude jungledude

@jungledude wrote:

Firewalls keep hackers out. ‘Viruswalls’ Don’t. I have a modem too and I needed to port forward you dumb idiot. So uhm… Fuck off?

item.title: Help with server actually being online
item.dc:creator: @xxxxxx_13 xxxxxx 13
item.description:
@xxxxxx_13 wrote:

erm hey smart guy i have a modem and dont need to port forward. therefore even with port exceptions in my firewall it wont run without taking firewall down. thats why you get a virus wall.

item.title: Help with server actually being online
item.dc:creator: @jungledude jungledude
item.description:
@jungledude wrote:

xxxxxx 13:

oh and also is your fire wall up? if so take it down. i had weeks worth of trying to figure it out then a noob suggested about the firewall and he was right XD

Never put your firewall down you stupid baboon. If you need to put your firewall down that means you didn’t port forward correctly.

item.description:
@Steviie wrote:

Please note, when you are portforwarding and creating your NO-IP you need to have your runserver.bat OPEN!!!

item.title: Help with server actually being online
item.dc:creator: @Super_Novex Super Novex
item.description:
@Super_Novex wrote:

Yeah, I am compiling the server. And after that I run it. But the only way for someone to get on (only me) is localhost. You know how when you run the server it says a port on it? Am I supposed to use that one? Anyway, I go on another computer, use a different user name, type in the no-ip adress, and the port the RunServer says. But it says I can’t get on. I don’t know what is being left out for this all to connect.[br][size=1]Posted on: August 21, 2007, 06:43:40 PM[/size][hr]Is this supposed to happen when you compile?[br][size=1]Posted on: August 21, 2007, 06:57:08 PM[/size][hr]Help please?

Read full topic
